title: How to dump firmware from an SD card?
content:
I have an SD card that implements some strange Write-Once-Read-Many technology that I want to check the firmware of. I'm not new to reverse-engineering, but I've never dumped firmware from an SD card before.

Any guidance on where to begin would be appreciated?

comments.text: Have you tried to use one of hdd partition manager? This enables you to copy entire disk into another.
@MaciejLos: no I haven't. Would that allow me access to firmware though?
They can read firmware ID (number), etc. What kind of SD card do you have and why do you need to read firmware?
